preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Djibril is a mentor in a big software company called CHEETAH. Jorge is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Djibril is a strict and demanding mentor. Djibril has high expectations for their mentee. Djibril goes straight to the point and is very clear.
    Jorge is a creative and innovative thinker. Jorge likes to experiment with new ideas and approaches. Jorge is not afraid to take risks and try new things. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Djibril the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a long conversation between Djibril and Jorge. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. Djibril wants Jorge to never use the ticketing system. Djibril gives some specific coding instructions to Jorge. Djibril wants Jorge to never use the ticketing system. Djibril does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Djibril never says 'for example'. Djibril does not give any other coding instructions. Jorge only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Djibril and Jorge. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. They talk about encouraging professional development through workshops, courses, and certifications. After that, Djibril gives some specific coding instructions to Jorge. Djibril wants Jorge to always start function argument names with 'i_'. Djibril wants Jorge to always start variable names with 'w_'. Djibril does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Djibril never says 'for example'. Djibril does not give any other coding instructions. Jorge only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Djibril and Jorge. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. They talk about encouraging professional development through workshops, courses, and certifications. They had a previous conversation about this before. After that, Djibril gives some specific coding instructions to Jorge. Djibril wants Jorge to always add the '@require_kwargs' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all methods. Djibril does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Djibril never says 'for example'. Djibril does not give any other coding instructions. Jorge only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Djibril and Jorge. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. Djibril gives some specific coding instructions to Jorge. Djibril is updating a previous information given to Jorge: Djibril now wants Jorge to always start function argument names with 'x_'. Djibril does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Djibril never says 'for example'. Djibril does not give any other coding instructions. Jorge only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
